course.subject: BIEN
course.name: Modeling for Chemical and Biological Engineering
course.description: Modeling of physical, chemical and biological processes. Balance Equations. Dimensional and scaling analysis. Analytical and numerical solutions to initial and boundary value problems. Use of computer tools for engineering calculations. This course uses examples in the Bioengineering discipline. For BIEN students only.
course.prerequisites: MATH 1014 OR MATH 1020 OR MATH 1024

reviews.author: happy_squid
reviews.comment_content:
Broad contents are covered in this course including first order ODE, second order ODE, PDE, numerical methods and statistics.
Additionally, this course trains students to address and solve those engineering kinds of stuff with MATLAB.
To conclude, the content itself is very interesting and configured with essential topics that chemical and biological engineers have to be used to.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Henry is really good and the explanation was easy to understand. He solves and gives example calculations to enhance the understandings. He clears doubts really well and does not hesitate during the calculation (well prepared).
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was good and generous as this lecture opened this semester and consisted of students from different years.

GRADING WEIGHT
Homework 30%
Midterm 30%
Final 30%
Class participation 10%
reviews.comment_workload:
The homework was given only four times (They are given at the end of each topic).
The homework contains about 3 to 4 problems.
Students usually need to make models of the problems and write MATLAB codes.
Also, writing reports are extremely important to get a good grade.  They are definitely challenging and take a long time to solve (usually about 1 week).
In my point of view, the workload is high.

reviews.author: tymiu
reviews.title: Matlab course
reviews.comment_content: Better have good knowledge of matrix and basic programming language.
reviews.comment_teaching: His teaching is very good and willing to explain the steps clearly during lesson. He is nice and eager to answer your questions. The flipped-mode lecture requires students finish lecture videos before having lessons. And Henry would use lesson time to help solving the homework questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation (5%)
Online quizzes (10%)
Homework (25%)
Short exams (35%)
Project (25%)

No final and midterm but divided into 4 short exams which is not short actually...
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy workload. There is an assignment after each topic of lecture. While one assignment takes quite a long time to finish. Need ask TA for help.

reviews.author: Jooran
reviews.comment_content:
MATLAB mainly
But you have to have good knowledge of linear algebra and matrix. If you didn't take MATH2350 and MATH2011 before taking this course, it would be quite a demanding course for you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
his teaching is very good
he tries hard to improve his teaching qualities- frequently gets our feedback
reviews.comment_grading:
only few people can get A-range I think.
But you can easily get help from TA and prof. Henry as their help and support is very useful to complete the assignments.
reviews.comment_workload: we kinda need to work hard as there is an assignment to finish every three weeks which is quite demanding. We need to attend the tutorial to seek for help.

reviews.author: Anisha
reviews.comment_content: The content spans a broad range of topics such as odes, PDEs, numerical methods, and statistics. These mathematical concepts are used to model various chemical engineering scenarios such as bacterial growth and toxic leak in real life using MATLAB. In my opinion, a lot of the material consists of higher level courses of CENG and math, but should not be difficult to grasp if you attend all the classes and participate actively.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Henry is an excellent teacher and acknowledges that there are students of different years in the class. Hence, he puts in extra effort to explain the MATLAB codes to beginners and makes sure the assignments are doable. If you have never used MATLAB before, he also has tutorial videos on CANVAS which you should view beforehand.

The TA was also extremely helpful. He often spent hours with us prior to deadlines to make sure everyone understood the questions and could do the homework.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was pretty lenient in my opinion. I got just above mean in 3 out of 4 assignments and the finals. In midterms, I got just below mean and on one assignment, I got well above the mean.
Final grade was B+
reviews.comment_workload: There were 4 assignments in total and they were 2-3 weeks long each. They were extremely challenging, which Henry meant to do as he expected us to learn from them. There were weekly and even extra tutorials sometimes for the assignments so we could ask questions and even ask the TA or the professor to debug our codes.
